revision.comment: /* List of notable fractal programs */ Per note: "This list should only include programs which already have Wikipedia articles"
revision.text:
'''Fractal-generating software''' is any computer program that generates images of [[fractals]]. There are many fractal generating programs available, both free and commercial.
==Features== Many different features are included in fractal-generating software packages. Most feature some form of [[algorithm]] selection, an interactive image zoom, and the ability to save files in [[JPEG]], [[TIFF]], or [[Portable Network Graphics|PNG]] format, as well as the ability to save parameter files, allowing the user to easily return to previously created images for later modification or exploration.
Many packages also allow the user to input their own formulae, to allow for greater control of the fractals, as well as a choice of color rendering, along with the use of filters and other image manipulation techniques. Some fractal software packages allow for the creation of movies from a sequence of fractal images.
Some standard graphics software (such as [[GIMP]]) contains filters or plug-ins which can be used for fractal generation. Many stand-alone fractal-generating programs can be used in conjunction with other graphics programs (such as [[Photoshop]]) to create more complex images.
==List of notable fractal programs== There are many fractal generating programs available, both free and commercial. Notable fractal generating programs include:
<!-- This list should only include programs which already have Wikipedia articles --> * [[Apophysis (software)|Apophysis]] – [[open source]] software for [[Microsoft Windows]] based systems * [[Chaotica (software)|Chaotica]] – commercial software for [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Linux]] and [[Mac OS]] * [[Electric Sheep]] – [[open source]] distributed computing software * [[Fractint]] – [[freeware]] with available [[source code]] * [[Kalles Fraktaler]] – Windows based fractal zoomer * [[Sterling (program)|Sterling]] – freeware software for [[Microsoft Windows]] * [[Terragen]] – a [[fractal terrain]] generator * [[Ultra Fractal]] – [[proprietary software|proprietary]] fractal generator for [[Microsoft Windows]] and [[Mac OS X]] * [[XaoS]] – cross platform [[open source]] fractal zooming program <!-- Please alphabetize -->
Most of the above programs make two-dimensional fractals, with a few creating three-dimensional fractal objects, such as [[quaternion]]s, [[mandelbulb]]s and [[mandelbox]]es.
==See also== * [[Fractal art]]
==References== {{no footnotes|date=August 2016}} {{reflist}}
==External links== <!--========================({{No More Links}})============================ | PLEASE BE CAUTIOUS IN ADDING MORE LINKS TO THIS ARTICLE.
